problem:
\begin{problem*}{}{}
  Let $a_2$, $a_3$, \dots, $a_n$ be positive reals,
  $n \ge 3$, satisfying
  \[
    a_2 a_3 \dotsm a_n = 1.
  \]
  Prove that
  \[
    (1+a_2)^2 (1+a_3)^3 \dotsm (1+a_n)^n > n^n.
  \]
\end{problem*}
solution:
\begin{soln}
  Note that
  \begin{align*}
    &(1+a_2)^2 (1+a_3)^3 \dotsm (1+a_n)^n \\
    &= (1+a_2)^2 \left(\frac 12+\frac 12+a_3\right)^3 \dotsm
    \left(\frac 1{n-1}+\dotsb+\frac 1{n-1}+a_n\right)^n \\
    &\ge (2^2 \times 3^3 \times \dotsm \times n^n)
    \left(\frac 1{2^2} \times \frac 1{3^3}
    \times \dotsm \times \frac 1{(n-1)^{n-1}}\right)
    a_2 a_3 \dotsm a_n \\
    &= n^n.
  \end{align*}
  For equality to hold, we need
  \[
    a_2 = 1, a_3 = \frac 12, \dots, a_n = \frac 1{n-1}.
  \]
  But then
  \[
  1 = a_2 a_3 \dotsm a_n
  = 1 \times \frac 12 \times
  \dotsm \times \frac 1{n-1} < 1
  \]
  which is not possible. Hence,
  \[
  (1+a_2)^2 (1+a_3)^3 \dotsm (1+a_n)^n > n^n,
  \]
  as desired.
\end{soln}
